abstract: The consortium behind the 11.2 billion Australian dollars ($8.7 billion) buyout proposal for Qantas Airwaysmoved closer to closing the deal Tuesday when the Australian government said it would not oppose the transaction. The government was under immense pressure from unions, politicians and members of the public to veto the takeover under its foreign investment laws, as it had done in 2001 when Royal Dutch Shell bid 10 billion Australian dollars for Woodside Petroleum.
lead_paragraph: The consortium behind the 11.2 billion Australian dollars ($8.7 billion) buyout proposal for Qantas Airwaysmoved closer to closing the deal Tuesday when the Australian government said it would not oppose the transaction. The government was under immense pressure from unions, politicians and members of the public to veto the takeover under its foreign investment laws, as it had done in 2001 when Royal Dutch Shell bid 10 billion Australian dollars for Woodside Petroleum.
